message.content:
The notepads are made of paper that is folded three times, so each side is 1/3 of an inch in length. When the paper is cut along the lines, it is cut in half, so each line is 1/6 of an inch in length. The stacked note papers are 1-inch high each.

If someone writes ten notes per day, there are 10 notes on each notepad. To find out how long one notepad would last, we need to calculate the total length of the paper used.

The total length of the paper used is the length of one side of the paper multiplied by the number of sides. Since the paper is folded three times, the total length of the paper is 3 times the length of one side.

The length of one side of the paper is 1/3 inch, so the total length of the paper is 3 * (1/3) inches = 1 inch.

Since the notepads are made of 1-inch high each, they are stacked 10 notes high. The total length of the notepad is the length of one side of the paper multiplied by the number of notes and the height of the notes.

The length of one side of the paper is 1/3 inch, so the total length of the notepad is 3 * (1/3) inches * 10 notes = 1 inch * 10 notes = 10 inches.

So, one notepad would last for 10 inches..
